meanings.definition: Side by side and having the same distance continuously between them.
meanings.sent1: The two parallelled lines never meet.
meanings.sent2: The parallelled tracks run alongside each other.
meanings.sent3: The parallelled paths of the ants made a neat pattern on the ground.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts and actions were parallelled, showing great consistency.
meanings.sent5: The parallelled rows of trees created a beautiful symmetry in the garden.

meanings.definition: To be similar or corresponding to something else.
meanings.sent1: His painting parallelled the style of the famous artist.
meanings.sent2: The results of the experiment parallelled those of previous studies.
meanings.sent3: The way he dressed parallelled his best friend's fashion sense.
meanings.sent4: Her success in the competition parallelled her dedication and hard work.
meanings.sent5: The growth of the plants parallelled the changing seasons.

meanings.definition: To happen at the same time as something else.
meanings.sent1: The thunder parallelled the lightning in the storm.
meanings.sent2: Her laughter parallelled the sound of the fireworks outside.
meanings.sent3: The car honking parallelled the barking of the neighbor's dog.
meanings.sent4: The cheers of the crowd parallelled the music playing in the stadium.
meanings.sent5: The chirping of the birds parallelled the rustling of the leaves in the wind.
